Information: Directed and implemented migration to cloud-based ERP and point of sale for ~30-employee business in Mexico, resulting in multi-fold reduction in manual data entry processes, 100x increase in data volume, SKU alignment across 5 branches, and central interface for procurement, accounting, and inventory.

Item: SLAC Nat'l Accelerator Lab LZ Offline Computing
Information: Deployed Trino and Superset on kubernetes to visualize LZ metadata with 4-100x query speedups. Validated migration of pulse reconstruction software to new operating system at 1 ppb level. Managed releases for main LZ analysis package and LZ computing environment. Co-coordinated migration of >400k files from >500 users to a Google Shared Drive with 95% success.

Item: Lawrence Livermore Nat'l Lab RED Group
Information: Developed novel analysis of low-energy ionization noise in LZ. Designed machineable ceramic components for a dual-phase xenon time projection chamber (TPC) and measured 2x reduction in said noise. Designed and built gas sampling system with 5 ppm sensitivity for a xenon-doped argon test stand.
Designed and analyzed thermal control platform to improve superconducting qubit sample quality.

Item: SLAC Nat'l Accelerator Lab Noble Liquids Group
Information: Directed and performed retrofits of LZ System Test thermosyphons. Designed cleanroom for LZ grid tests. Built out hundred-liter scale automatic liquid nitrogen delivery systems. Assisted with xenon sampling and purification efforts.
Simulated electric fields for a prototype liquid xenon purity monitor.

Item: Lawrence Berkeley Nat'l Lab Sorensen Group
Information: Simulated electric fields in a novel TPC with charge readout capabilities. Tested and installed charge-shaping amplifiers. Assisted in testing a novel high voltage feedthrough design.
Assisted in design and assembly of world-leading test for neutron-sector violations of Lorentz symmetry using quartz crystal oscillators.

Item: LZ Analysis Workshop; Python, VSCode Tutorials
UMD Undergraduate Physics for Biologists I \& II
Information: Led 2, 25-person laboratory sections per semester, hosted weekly office hours, and developed interactive course materials in use for > 4 years for instructing 180 students per semester on data acquisition, handling and processing techniques.
Co-led seminar for undergraduates on cutting-edge physics research at UC Berkeley and arranged for weekly speakers.
